text: Robert Arthur Morton Stern, usually credited as Robert A. M. Stern (born May 23, 1939), is an American architect. He is currently the Dean of the Yale School of Architecture. He is known for his works 15 Central Park West, Comcast Center, and the Norman Rockwell Museum. His buildings are mostly postmodernism. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:Living people Category:American architects Category:People from New York City
title: Robert A. M. Stern
